data.title: Caretaker fail, uninpressed
data.text:
I read that you have to knock on the door hard to get the person to come, but either they are deaf or, worse, naughty and lazy because I was at least 15 minutes before closing time and nobody came to the door. I'm bitterly disappointed as I really wanted to pay my respects to the birthplace of the Blues. 
Could Do Better.

data.title: Birth of Blues
data.text: The home of Ma Rainey in Columbus,GA. is the birthplace of the Blues and Ma is the "Mother of the Blues". Her Liberty Theatre is a few blocks away and also worth seeing. A free tour by a very nice lady is a pleasure.

data.title: Surprised
data.text: I was really surprised at what I saw.  The house has been freshly painted and the  museum is just the downstairs of the house.  A lot of memorabilia to take in.  Wasn't sure I was going to get in....make sure you knock loud so the care taker hears you. You gotta go!

data.title: Do people even know this is here?
data.text: Do people even know this is here? Ma Rainey,Louis Armstrong,old 78's,Ma Rainey's old piano! Old blues playin' while you walk around.See this place before it closes and all we're stuck with is that rap garbage.

data.title: FREE House Tour
data.text:
You can view the first floor of the renovated home. It contains artifacts and stories about the singer from Columbus, GA. You will be led by a docent.

FYI: The doors are locked, so you must be patient and wait for the tour guide to hear you knocking at the door.

data.title: MA RAINEY
data.text: C'est par hasard que j'ai découvert l'histoire de Ma Rainey et ai eu envie d'en connaître plus et de voir la maison où elle est née et où elle a fini sa vie.  Maison somme toute très modeste.  Nous sommes accueillis par une grande fan de blues et de Ma Rainey qui nous fait partager son histoire.  On en ressort avec un mélange de sentiments d'admiration pour cette femme somme toute très humble, de tristesse et de questionnement.  La maison se trouve un peu éloignée de la Broadway avenue. N'ayant pas énormément de visiteurs le musée risque de fermer.
